intro: Maerua intricata, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots that help it access water. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Maerua intricata is often used in traditional medicine and for soil stabilization in degraded landscapes.
